titleStmt.title: Walters Ms. W.643, Three short Sufi works
Lavāyiḥ
لوايح
Lavāmiʿ
لوامع

title.note: A commentary on the famous Arabic "Wine poem" (Khamrīyah) by ʿUmar ibn Fāriḍ (d. 632 AH / 1235 CE), in the text referred to as qaṣīdah-i mīmīyah-i khamrīyah-i Fāriḍīyah

titleStmt.title: Nay nāmah
ني نامه

title.note: Title supplied by cataloger; commentary on the first verses of the Mas̱navī by Jalāl al-Dīn Rūmī (d. 672 AH / 1273 CE); also known as the "Song of the flute" (Nay nāmah)

author.name: Jāmī, 1414-1492
Nūr al-Dīn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad Jāmī
نور الدين عبد الرحمان بن احمد جامي
Author dates preferred by cataloger: d. 898 AH / 1492 CE

respStmt.name: Bābā Shāh ibn Sulṭān ʿAlī Iṣfahānī
بابا شاه بن سلطان علي اصفهاني
For the calligrapher Bābā Shāh ibn Sulṭān ʿAlī Iṣfahānī see Bayānī, Mahdī. Aḥvāl va ās̲ār-i khvushʹnavīsān, Vol 1. (Tehran: Instishārāt-i ʻIlmī, 1363 [1984 or 1985]), no.138.

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: This is an illuminated manuscript comprised of three short works on Sufism by Nūr al-Dīn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Jāmī (d. 898 AH / 1492 CE), produced in Safavid Iran. The first work is called Lavāyiḥ and consists of a collection of apophthegms. The second work is a commentary on the famous Arabic "Wine poem" (Khamrīyah) by ʿUmar ibn Fāriḍ (d. 632 AH / 1235 CE). The third work is a commentary on the "Song of the flute" from the beginning of the Mas̱navī of Jalāl al-Dīn Rūmī (d. 672 AH / 1273 CE). The manuscript was written in nastaʿlīq script by the well-known Iranian calligrapher Bābā Shāh ibn Sulṭān ʿAlī Iṣfahānī in 999 AH / 1591 CE. There is a note dated to the year 1105 AH / 1694 CE on fol. 1a indicating that the manuscript is made up of two papers: Samarqandī (for the text) and Dawlatābādī (for the margins). There are also seals dating between the eleventh century AH / seventeenth CE and the thirteenth century AH / nineteenth CE.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Persian. The secondary language of this manuscript is Arabic.

msItem.title: Lavāyiḥ
لوايح
msItem.incipit: لا احصى ثناء عليك كيف كل ثناء يعود اليك...

colophon.note: katabahau al-ʿabd al-mudhnib Bābā Shāh Iṣfahānī
Only gives the name of the calligrapher

msItem.title: Lavāmiʿ
لوامع

title.note: A commentary on the famous Arabic "Wine poem" (Khamrīyah) by ʿUmar ibn Fāriḍ (d. 632 AH / 1235 CE), in the text referred to as qaṣīdah-i mīmīyah-i khamrīyah-i Fāriḍīyah

msItem.incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم رب انعمت فزد سبحانه من جميل ليس لوجهه...
msItem.note: Title inscribed at the beginning of the text

msItem.title: Nay nāmah
ني نامه

title.note: Title supplied by cataloger; commentary on the first verses of the Mas̱navī by Jalāl al-Dīn Rūmī (d. 672 AH / 1273 CE); also known as the "Song of the flute" (Nay nāmah)

msItem.incipit: عشق جز نایی وما جز نى نه ايم...

colophon.note: tammat hadhā [sic] al-risālah al-sharīfa[h] /1/ mushtamal [sic] ʿalá nikāt laṭīfah /2/ fī tafsīr abyāt maʿnawīyah ʿalá /3/ al-ṣadr al-Mathawī al-Maʿnawī /4/ qaddasa sirruhu al-ʿazīz Jalāl /5/ al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Rūmī ʿalayhi /6/ al-raḥmah wa-al-ghufrān /7/ ʿalá yad al-kātib al-faqīr Bābā Sāh bn Sulṭān /8/ ʿAlī Iṣfahānī /9/ fī shahr Rajab al-murajjab /10/ sanat tisʿ wa-tisʿīn wa-tisʿimi<ʾ>ah /11/ al-hijrīyah al-nabawīyah /12/
In Arabic; explains the nature of the work and gives the name of the calligrapher and the date of copying as Rajab 999 AH / 1591 CE

support.p: Rose-tinted laid paper; a note dated 22 Jum. II 1105 AH / 1694 CE states that this codex is made up of two papers: Samarqandī (for the text) and Dawlatābādī (for the margins) (fol. 1a)

supportDesc.foliation: Earlier foliation in Hindu-Arabic numerals in the middle of the upper margin above the frame

layoutDesc.layout: Text consists of two panels within a thick frame: the outer (ḥāshiyah) panel and the inner (matn) panel; the text of Lavāyiḥ is located in the inner panel
Text (written obliquely) begins in the outer margin within the frame

handDesc.handNote: Written in nastaʿlīq script in black with incidentals in gold ink
Written in nastaʿlīq script in black with incidentals in gold ink
Written in nastaʿlīq script in black with incidentals in gold ink

decoDesc.decoNote: Titlepiece with title inscribed in white ink; interlinear gilt decoration; small triangular pieces and a double frame
Titlepiece with title inscribed in white ink; interlinear gilt decoration; small triangular pieces and a double frame
Small headpiece on a gilt ground

decoNote.title: Incipit page with illuminated titlepiece
decoNote.note: This is an illuminated incipit page bearing a titlepiece inscribed Lavāyiḥ in white tawqīʿ script. In the outer margin is inscribed the text of the second work, Lavāmiʿ.

decoNote.title: Colophon
decoNote.note: This colophon concludes with the inscription: katabahau al-ʿabd al-mudhnib Bābā Shāh Iṣfahānī.

decoNote.title: Colophon
decoNote.note: This colophon explains the nature of the work and gives the name of the calligrapher and the date of copying as Rajab 999 AH / 1591 CE. It reads: tammat hadhā [sic] al-risālah al-sharīfa[h] /1/ mushtamal [sic] ʿalá nikāt laṭīfah /2/ fī tafsīr abyāt maʿnawīyah ʿalá /3/ al-ṣadr al-Mathawī al-Maʿnawī /4/ qaddasa sirruhu al-ʿazīz Jalāl /5/ al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Rūmī ʿalayhi /6/ al-raḥmah wa-al-ghufrān /7/ ʿalá yad al-kātib al-faqīr Bābā Sāh bn Sulṭān /8/ ʿAlī Iṣfahānī /9/ fī shahr Rajab al-murajjab /10/ sanat tisʿ wa-tisʿīn wa-tisʿimi<ʾ>ah /11/ al-hijrīyah al-nabawīyah /12/

binding.p: Dark brown leather (with flap) attached backwards; gold-brushed panel-stamped design; doublures with filigree work on a multi-colored ground of blue, orange, pink, and green

history.provenance: Round seal (in the center) of Allāh Muḥammad ʿAlī, 1030 AH / 1620-1 CE (fol. 1a)
Note dated 22 Jum. II 1105 AH / 1694 CE (fol. 1a)
Square seal with the name Maḥmūd (partially erased) and an inscription with the date 1115 AH / 1703-4 CE (fol. 1a)
Octagonal seal of Ḥusayn Shāh Ghulāmī underneath an inscription giving the date Dhū al-Qaʿdah 1127 AH / 1715 CE (fol. 1a)
Ownership statement of Ḥusayn Qavam [?] Daftar, 1301 AH / 1883-4 (fol. 2a)
history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters bequest
